article.headline: IUPUI 77, IPFW 59
article.story: INDIANAPOLIS (AP) -- George Hill scored 33 points on 11-for-17 shooting to lead IUPUI to a 77-59 win over IPFW Saturday night. Hill made 4-of-8 3-pointers and 7-of-8 free throws and also contributed five assists for the Jaguars (15-5, 7-2). Austin Montgomery added 15 points and Jon Avery scored 11, as IUPUI made 28-of-50 field goals, or 56 percent, for the game. The Jaguars also hit eight-of-18 3-pointers. The Mastodons (7-13, 4-5) made 22-of-47 field goals, or 46 percent. Jaraun Burrows led IPFW with 19 points, and Chris Perkins added 10 and three steals. He was the only other Mastodon to reach double figures. IUPUI led 39-28 at halftime, after sinking 15-of-25 field goals. Both teams grabbed 25 rebounds each. The victory marked IUPUI's 11th straight home win and pushed the Jaguars' lead in the series between the two schools to 18-9. Saturday's game marked the first time the teams met as Summit League foes.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
